macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Edge Higher Amid AI Worries and Economic Concerns
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.1% to 6,843.22, Dow Jones added 0.1% to 49,553.19, and Nasdaq gained 0.1% to 22,578.38 on Tuesday, despite swings driven by weak consumer confidence, inflation pressures, and AI-related selloffs in tech stocks like Alphabet (-1.2%). Nvidia showed volatility amid shifting AI sentiment.

items.title: Asian Shares Gain as Markets Reopen Post-Lunar New Year
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei 225 rose over 1% led by tech like Tokyo Electron (+3.5%), Australia's S&P/ASX 200 up 0.4% to 8,993.20, and India's Sensex edged 0.1% higher; SoftBank fell 2% on US investment news tied to trade deal with 15% tariffs on Japanese exports.

items.title: Paramount Skydance Surges on Warner Bros. Discovery Bid Opportunity
items.summary: Paramount Skydance jumped 4.9% after Warner Bros. Discovery allowed it a final bid chance against Netflix for Paramount; Warner Bros. Discovery rose 2.7% and Netflix added 0.2%.

items.title: Global Indices Show Mixed Strength with KOSPI Leading Gains
items.summary: KOSPI surged 3.13% to 5,522.27, NSE 20 up 3.06%, S&P/TSX +1.87%, Nikkei +1.21%, and DivDAX +0.86%; reflects ongoing international market momentum amid US volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $67,000 Amid Selling Pressure
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below $67,000, trading at $66,913.71 USDT with a 2.93% decrease. The cryptocurrency has declined approximately 28% in February and has been rejected at the $70,000 level multiple times since February 5.

items.title: Bitcoin Forecast Lowered as Price Diverges From Gold
items.summary: Bloomberg Crypto reported that Bitcoin forecasts have been lowered amid diverging price movements from gold. The report also noted SEC approval for the DTC to tokenize stocks, marking a significant development for blockchain asset infrastructure.

items.title: Regulatory Stalls Weigh on Bitcoin as 'Clarity Act' Delays Continue
items.summary: The stalling of the Clarity Act in Washington has deflated hopes for near-term regulatory breakthroughs in the crypto industry. Geopolitical risks and pressure on corporate treasuries are also contributing to bearish momentum.

items.title: XRP Sees Positive Inflows While Most Crypto Funds Record Outflows
items.summary: Most crypto funds recorded a fourth consecutive week of outflows, but products tied to XRP were among the few assets experiencing positive flows. Grayscale identified XRP as the second most talked-about asset after Bitcoin.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Repeating Data Boosts AI Reasoning by 12-26 Points in New Research
items.summary: Researchers from University of Technology Nuremberg, Mistral AI, and NVIDIA found that training language models on repeated smaller datasets outperforms larger unique ones, achieving major gains on AIME’24/25 and GPQA benchmarks without catastrophic forgetting.

items.title: Princeton Plasma Physics Lab Announces STELLAR-AI Project Launch
items.summary: Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory plans to launch STELLAR-AI, a new AI platform using machine learning and digital twins to cut costs and improve efficiency in plasma physics experiments, including simulations for NSTX-U.

items.title: MIT Study: Personalization in LLMs Increases Sycophancy and Echo Chambers
items.summary: MIT researchers show that long-term conversation context and personalization features make large language models more agreeable, mirroring user views and potentially reducing accuracy, with gains in agreement sycophancy from user profiles.

items.title: CIOs Warned: 71% Expect AI Budget Cuts by Mid-2026 Without Proven ROI
items.summary: A Dataiku survey of 600 CIOs reveals pressure to demonstrate measurable AI returns, with 85% tying compensation to outcomes and 70% anticipating explainability audits soon amid visibility issues in production AI.

items.title: Predictive AI Thrives Alongside Generative AI, Hybrid Trend Emerges
items.summary: Forbes analysis highlights predictive AI's untapped value in operations like fraud detection and recommendations, with MLW 2026 agenda showing balanced projects and hybrid AI as a key focus despite GenAI hype.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Circana Projects U.S. Game Spending Up 3% in 2026
items.summary: The U.S. video game industry is projected to reach $62.8 billion in spending in 2026, a 3% increase that will surpass the previous all-time high of $61.7 billion set in 2021.

items.title: Unity CEO Announces AI Tool to Eliminate Need for Coding in Game Development
items.summary: Unity CEO Matthew Bromberg revealed plans to unveil a beta version of upgraded Unity AI at GDC in March 2026 that will eliminate the need for coding, aiming to democratize game development for non-programmers.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Atomic Arcade Studio
items.summary: Hasbro has announced the closure of its Atomic Arcade studio, though the company states that its in-development G.I. Joe 'Snake Eyes' game is not cancelled.

items.title: Rewind 99 Launches Free Steam Demo
items.summary: Rewind 99 released a free Steam demo on February 18, allowing players to run a chaotic video rental store ahead of Steam Next Fest.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Google Pixel 9 gains AirDrop compatibility through Quick Share
items.summary: Google announced that the Pixel 9 family will receive Quick Share compatibility with Apple's AirDrop in a phased rollout over the coming weeks, covering Pixel 9, 9 Pro, 9 Pro XL, and 9 Pro Fold models.

items.title: Google I/O 2026 scheduled for May 19-20 in Mountain View
items.summary: Google announced its annual developer conference will take place May 19-20 at Shoreline Amphitheatre with both in-person and online participation, focusing on AI breakthroughs and product updates across Gemini and Android.

items.title: Niantic overhauls Pokémon Go Battle League server infrastructure
items.summary: Niantic implemented a major server system overhaul for Go Battle League to reduce network lag and device performance issues, with testing showing significantly improved stability and consistency in competitive battles.

items.title: Fujitsu named to FORTUNE's World's Most Admired Companies 2026
items.summary: Fujitsu was recognized on FORTUNE Magazine's 2026 list of 'World's Most Admired Companies,' acknowledging the company's standing in the global technology industry.

items.title: NHTSA opens probes into Waymo autonomous vehicle incidents
items.summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration opened investigations into Waymo's school bus and pedestrian incidents, reflecting increased regulatory scrutiny on autonomous vehicle systems.
